title: Name 1 viable melee dmg champion
body:
Who is not Yasuo or Irelia


Hint: There is none.

replies.body: {{champion:2}}
Built full tank.

Build doesn't matter.

Olaf is picked almost entirely for his high damage (for ganks and clears) and his ability to kill the enemy backline during teamfights.

He is a damage-oriented melee champion even if he doesn't build offensive items.
But still somehow manages to do a shitton of damage, especially midgame.

http://champion.gg/

What's this, Nunu highest winrate jungle? Jarvan highest top? I'm really not surprised that you're this blind to the game considering you're from EUW LOL.

calling him blind and insulting him while saying dumb shit. choose one

i'm glad you are so good at this game to consider nunu a damage champion. you can't consider jarvan top viable with a sample of 0.20% playrate

Honestly, Nunu can deal a lot of damage when built appropriately.

A fairly common build on him a couple patches ago was along the lines of:
{{item:3111}}  {{item:1413}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3026}} 

You could gib squishy champions rather easily.

well i guess that works but at least he's not meant to be a damage dealer xD
it's similar to how you call assassins with tanky items bruisers instead of tanks

i don't mean to be rude but you are mistaken on what both Viable and Damage Dealer means.  

Viable means a champion is not intentionally weak like Kalista or Azir. In this case most of the roster is "viable".  

Damage Dealers do not necessarily need to build full damage, champions like Hecarim, Olaf, Garen, Darius, and Volibear tend to build Bruiser, Juggernaut, or even full Tank. Their goal however is primarily to deal damage or they deal a lot of damage due to the nature of their kit (like Volibear who deals more damage based on his tankiness). These would fit under the category of Damage Melee champions.

I didn't really mean viable, my bad, since he used the highest winrate stat i thought he meant viable as in strong. as you see i'm eu so my english is limited lol

about rudeness, i don't get offended that easily dw man xD if you wanna flame me just go on, free yourself

I agree with you though, the champions you listed are bruisers and are meant to do damage, but nunu is a tank (from what i know, unless you go the titanic hydra build) and i don't think his damage is that special. His kit isn't revolved about damage compared to someone like hecarim who is meant to dive the backline and has abilities that help him do that. Nunu just soaks most of the damage and even though he's melee, I don't think you can call him a damage dealer. By that logic, every single champion in the game is a damage dealer

I don't want to flame, it just sounded a lot meaner in my head when I was just being blunt. So I thought I would clarify I wasn't being rude, just straightforward.  

What I mean when I say Damage Dealer is that their kit is meant to just deal damage. It doesn't need to deal a lot of damage, but it is their primary goal. You are right though Nunu is not the best example, he is more of a tank than a damage dealer. His Q is for chasing and his ult is for catching or team fighting.

> it's similar to how you call assassins with tanky items bruisers instead of tanks

Unless they are Ekko.

Ekko legitimately has enough utility to be considered a tank when building defensive items.
I guess that works, but it got so nerfed it's not even worth playing it anymore to be honest

It has been worth playing almost the entire season.

It will only really disappear in pre-season with the assassin update gutting tank Ekko.  I still can't believe it took them this long to remove the base percentage heal on his ultimate and the slow from his passive...

Eh, I think he's been bad for a few pathes now :P It's only my opinion though, since he has been under 48% winrate since like 6.16 (which is kind of bad..? i guess)
He falls off so hard that he's almost useless later onto the game

He has been weakened, but he is still a pain in the ass at higher tiers of play.

Between Trinity Force and Fervor of Battle, he can still kill squishy champions rather easily.  Meanwhile, he still possesses a massive amount of utility, safety and mobility which can make him difficult to actually punish.

Yeah Nunu is build dmg...try to read the title next time.

ALso pretty sure EUW is considered a much better server and has produced far better players than NA.

"is build dmg" LOL. How about Jarvan? 
Honestly I thought you meant "melee champion" and judging by how poor your English is, it wasn't really a stretch. By the way good talent you're producing. Including G2 Trick (Season 6 MVP, from Korea), Huni (Season 5 MVP, from Korea) .
Yeah but nunu isn't a damage dealer, he's more of a disruptor tank.

Pick three
I like the blitzcrank pick ;)
Yup, some people don't realize Blitz is a physical fighter who became viable as a support solely because of his Q

Wtf is your definition of viable?

Top tier doesnt mean viable, how much they have been played in pro play also doesn't translate to viable
Jax, Darius, zed, diana, fiora, illaoi, jarvan, kassadin, katarina, lee sin, nasus, vi, wukong, renekton, riven, rumble
nasus, kassadin, and jax are far from viable right now.

orly?

also, shyvana .

kassadin lost his usefulness when he got his R kneecapped, he was no longer an anti mage, and he's no longer hyper mobile, he's good at clean up and thats about it. if you want a champ thats ap and good at dueling mages {{champion:112}} if you want a champ thats mobile and ap while being able to duel mages. {{champion:103}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:7}}. 

nasus unfortunately is super gutted by the adc meta. champions like {{champion:51}} {{champion:236}} and {{champion:202}} make it impossible to do anything in fights, you're just gonna get kited and crit into oblivion. add in a lot of really bad match ups that are meta like {{champion:126}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:68}}  and he's far from good right now. 

jax same problem as nasus only to a lesser degree on kiting but a higher degree on match ups i would argue. 

now don't get me wrong, you can still be a fucking legend and just play these guys and do well but thats you being gud, not the champ being viable.

sure mate that's why {{champion:78}} hasn't seen a single appearance in worlds, oh sorry she was a super contested pick i did not notice her because she was constantly harassed from range by {{champion:48}} and {{champion:98}} oh they are actually melee or why {{champion:223}} hasn't seen the light of day since forever, oh sorry Samsung says get him and get him first...
i didn't say anything about poppy :|
Kha'zix is one of the strongest junglers at the moment and builds primarily damage items.

He is one of the strongest because of all the free damage he gets for playing normally. 

Isolation damage is absurd.

Kha'zix doesn't get "free damage". 

That would be like saying Nautilus and Sejuani have free CC, Ahri has free sustain or Rammus has free defensive stats.

It is part of their kit and they are balanced around it.  That does not by any means make it free.

Nautilus and Sejuani are gated by mana.

Kha'zix could have zero mana and still do isolation damage.

What do you put into it that makes you "buy" isolation? Nothing.

If you don't buy it, and its not gated, its free.

> Kha'zix could have zero mana and still do isolation damage.

Considering isolation only affects Kha'zix's Q and it has a mana cost, he couldn't.  

It is an ability like any other, only amplified because it has part of his ultimate's power budget.  It suffers similar gating limitations as all other mana-using champions face.
